comments.content: If this is from a jenkins build, could you include the link to the review that triggered it?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~david-kranz

comments.content:
I have analyzed the cause of this, and it looks like a bug in nova.

From the compute log when this happens, the following exception is thrown in confirm_resize:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/opt/stack/new/nova/nova/openstack/common/rpc/amqp.py", line 430, in _process_data
    rval = self.proxy.dispatch(ctxt, version, method, **args)
  File "/opt/stack/new/nova/nova/openstack/common/rpc/dispatcher.py", line 133, in dispatch
    return getattr(proxyobj, method)(ctxt, **kwargs)
  File "/opt/stack/new/nova/nova/exception.py", line 117, in wrapped
    temp_level, payload)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/contextlib.py", line 24, in __exit__
    self.gen.next()
  File "/opt/stack/new/nova/nova/exception.py", line 94, in wrapped
    return f(self, context, *args, **kw)
  File "/opt/stack/new/nova/nova/compute/manager.py", line 260, in decorated_function
    function(self, context, *args, **kwargs)
  File "/opt/stack/new/nova/nova/compute/manager.py", line 237, in decorated_function
    e, sys.exc_info())
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/contextlib.py", line 24, in __exit__
    self.gen.next()
  File "/opt/stack/new/nova/nova/compute/manager.py", line 224, in decorated_function
    return function(self, context, *args, **kwargs)
  File "/opt/stack/new/nova/nova/compute/manager.py", line 2119, in confirm_resize
    rt.confirm_resize(context, migration)
  File "/opt/stack/new/nova/nova/compute/resource_tracker.py", line 370, in confirm_resize
    self.update_available_resource(elevated)
  File "/opt/stack/new/nova/nova/openstack/common/lockutils.py", line 242, in inner
    retval = f(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/opt/stack/new/nova/nova/compute/resource_tracker.py", line 238, in update_available_resource
    resources = self.driver.get_available_resource(self.nodename)
  File "/opt/stack/new/nova/nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py", line 2826, in get_available_resource
    'disk_available_least': _get_disk_available_least()}
  File "/opt/stack/new/nova/nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py", line 2810, in _get_disk_available_least
    disk_over_committed = self.get_disk_over_committed_size_total()
  File "/opt/stack/new/nova/nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py", line 3398, in get_disk_over_committed_size_total
    i_vt_sz = int(info['virt_disk_size'])
TypeError: int() argument must be a string or a number, not 'NoneType'

As a result, the instance state is set to ERROR as stated in the log:

ERROR [nova.compute.manager] int() argument must be a string or a number, not 'NoneType'. Setting instance vm_state to ERROR
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hanlind

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/26750
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
Reviewed:  https://review.openstack.org/26750
Committed: http://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/fd26589afa2852762575feaae95a0c9b0c091461
Submitter: Jenkins
Branch:    master

commit fd26589afa2852762575feaae95a0c9b0c091461
Author: Hans Lindgren <email address hidden>
Date:   Thu Apr 11 16:05:23 2013 +0200

    Make sure confirm_resize finishes before setting vm_state to ACTIVE
    
    Setting it to ACTIVE to early will allow new resize or whatever
    operations to start before the current confirm has finished which
    might result in all sorts of conflicts.
    
    Resolves bug 1161529 where an intermittent failure in a tempest test
    happens because a confirm operation conflicts with a later resize
    carried out on the same instance. As the new resize starts to move
    around instance disks, the still not finished confirm operation might
    fail at recalculating total disk usage due to a missing disk.
    
    Other possible conflicts might be due to system_metadata and/or quota
    not being up-to-date at the moment the instance becomes ACTIVE.
    
    Change-Id: I079da4e271469739504fa87e23149d03652d98f0
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

commit 129d118b360e016b7f7d9373665b09ee46f92df7
Author: Hans Lindgren <email address hidden>
Date:   Thu Apr 11 16:05:23 2013 +0200

    Make sure confirm_resize finishes before setting vm_state to ACTIVE
    
    Setting it to ACTIVE to early will allow new resize or whatever
    operations to start before the current confirm has finished which
    might result in all sorts of conflicts.
    
    Resolves bug 1161529 where an intermittent failure in a tempest test
    happens because a confirm operation conflicts with a later resize
    carried out on the same instance. As the new resize starts to move
    around instance disks, the still not finished confirm operation might
    fail at recalculating total disk usage due to a missing disk.
    
    Other possible conflicts might be due to system_metadata and/or quota
    not being up-to-date at the moment the instance becomes ACTIVE.
    
    Change-Id: I079da4e271469739504fa87e23149d03652d98f0
    (cherry picked from commit fd26589afa2852762575feaae95a0c9b0c091461)
